author: COMSOL
description: A classic benchmark problem in computational electromagnetics is to solve for the radar cross section (RCS) of a sphere in free space illuminated by a plane wave. This example solves for the RCS of a metallic sphere that has a very high conductivity, which can be treated as a material with infinite conductivity. The results are compared to the analytic solution, and agreement is shown.
label: rcs_sphere.mph
name: root
